001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Application;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.LifecycleListener;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
011import squidpony.squidmath.StatefulRNG;
012
013/**
014 * Default BitmapFonts, a sample image, "stretchable" fonts and icons, and a central RNG for use with libGDX.
015 * All but one of the resources here need to be downloaded separately, to avoid bloating the size of the dependency jar
016 * with many fonts that a game probably won't use. You can download assets in a jar with a release of SquidLib, or
017 * individually from https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/tree/master/assets . The assets you choose should go in the
018 * android/assets (core/assets if you don't have an Android project) subfolder of your game if you use the normal libGDX
019 * setup tool or SquidSetup, or the assets subfolder if you use czyzby's alternate setup tool,
020 * https://github.com/czyzby/gdx-setup . They should not be placed in subdirectories of assets, otherwise this won't be
021 * able to find them.
022 * <br>
023 * The fonts provided are mostly monospaced, with most looking rather similar (straight orthogonal lines and right-angle
024 * curves), but some that look... better than the rest. For monospaced fonts that could be used on a grid in SquidPanel
025 * or SquidLayers, it is recommended that you use a "stretchable" font (which use a signed distance field, or SDF,
026 * effect to stretch smoothly) or a "crisp" font (which use a multi-channel signed distance field, or MSDF, effect to
027 * stretch smoothly and remain sharp at very high zooms). For some usage you may want a TextFamily instead of a normal
028 * TextCellFactory or BitmapFont; these TextFamily fonts store regular, bold, italic, and bold-italic faces in one file,
029 * and {@link GDXMarkup} can produce text that will render in those faces. Some good choices for fonts here are
030 * Iosevka, which comes in a sans-serif version with {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, {@link #getCrispLeanFont()}, 
031 * {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}, and more, as well as a slab-serif version with {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()},
032 * {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, and {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}, among others, as well as Inconsolata-LGC, which is
033 * more geometric sans-serif accessible with {@link #getStretchableFont()}, or (well-suited for square glyphs)
034 * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} (it does not have a crisp variety). Another is Computer Modern, accessible by
035 * {@link #getStretchableTypewriterFont()}, which has a chunky, ornamented style. For variable-width fonts
036 * that can be used in TextPanel, among others, you can use the recommended crisp font family Noto Serif
037 * with {@link #getCrispPrintFamily()}, or for stretchable fonts there's the serif font Gentium with
038 * {@link #getStretchablePrintFont()} or Noto Sans with {@link #getStretchableCleanFont()} (Noto Sans currently has
039 * problems that Noto Serif does not have). All of the fonts so far support the Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic alphabets.
040 * <br>
041 * If you can't decide, go with {@link #getCrispLeanFont()} or {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, which return TextCellFactory
042 * objects, and call their .width(int), .height(int), and .initBySize() methods to make them the size (and aspect ratio)
043 * you want. You can use stretchable or crisp fonts with equal width and height to make
044 * a horizontally-stretched version of a square font instead of the existing square fonts that add blank space.
045 * <br>
046 * The most Latin script support for a monospaced font is in the font Mandrill, accessible by getDefaultUnicodeFont()
047 * and getLargeUnicodeFont() in two different sizes, and the latter should be suitable for everything from Spanish and
048 * French, to Polish to Vietnamese. You can use Gentium for even better language support with a variable-width font in
049 * TextPanel or the like; it is accessible with getStretchablePrintFont(). Google's Noto font also supports many glyphs
050 * in a variable-width format; it is accessible with getStretchableCleanFont() but may have some issues with baseline
051 * level changing and character-to-character alignment seeming too high or low.
052 * <br>
053 * The sample image is a tentacle taken from a public domain icon collection graciously released by Henrique Lazarini;
054 * it's fitting for SquidLib to have a tentacle as a logo or something, I guess?
055 * <br>
056 * The icons are from http://game-icons.net , there are over 2000 of them, and they're among the only images that should
057 * both be recolor-able easily (like chars in a font) and resize-able easily if you use a stretchable font at the same
058 * time. The stretchable font TextCellFactories do some work with shaders that makes most images look incorrect, but
059 * allow distance field fonts and these distance field icons to resize smoothly. Mixing stretchable fonts with
060 * non-stretchable images or fonts is not a great idea, and usually involves a slow shader change back and forth.
061 * <br>
062 * You can get a default RNG with getGuiRandom(); this should probably not be reused for non-GUI-related randomness,
063 * but is meant instead to be used wherever randomized purely-aesthetic effects are needed, such as a jiggling effect.
064 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/11/2015.
065 */
066public class DefaultResources implements LifecycleListener {

152    public static final String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
153            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
154            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
155            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
156            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
157            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
158            + "\n"
159            + "void main() {\n"
160            + " v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
161            + " v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
162            + " v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
163            + " gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
164            + "}\n";
165
166    public static final String fragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
167            + " precision mediump float;\n"
168            + " precision mediump int;\n"
169            + "#endif\n"
170            + "\n"
171            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
172            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
173            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
174            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
175            + "\n"
176            + "void main() {\n"
177            + "  if (u_smoothing > 0.0) {\n"
178            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
179            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).a) +\n"
180            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).a) +\n"
181            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).a) +\n"
182            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).a);\n"
183            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, ((smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).a) + 0.5 * asum) / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
184            + "  } else {\n"
185            + "         gl_FragColor = v_color * texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n"
186            + "  }\n"
187            + "}\n";

195//            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"

197//            + "\n"

207    public static final String msdfFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
208            + " precision mediump float;\n"
209            + " precision mediump int;\n"
210            + "#endif\n"
211            + "\n"
212            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
213            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
214            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
215            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
216            + "\n"
217            + "void main() {\n"
218            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
219            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) * u_smoothing + 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
220            + "}\n";

233            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).rgb;\n"
234            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
235            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).rgb;\n"

237            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).rgb;\n"

241            //+ "}\n";
242    /**
243     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#fragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around characters.
244     * Only works with distance field fonts. You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would
245     * look like {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.outlineFragmentShader)}, and
246     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
247     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
248     */
249    public static final String outlineFragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
250            + "precision mediump float;\n"
251            + "precision mediump int;\n"
252            + "#endif\n"
253            + "\n"
254            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
255            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
256            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
257            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
258            + "\n"
259            + "void main() {\n"
260            + "  if(u_smoothing <= 0.0) {\n"
261            + "    float smoothing = -u_smoothing;\n"
262            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
263            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
264            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
265            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
266            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
267            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
268            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
269            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
270            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
271            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
272            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y)));\n"
273            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, (asum / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
274            + "  } else {\n"
275            + "    vec2 radistance = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
276            + "    float distance = min(radistance.x, radistance.y);\n"
277//            + "          vec2 box = vec2(0.0, 0.00375 * (u_smoothing + 0.0825));\n"
278//            + "          float asum = 0.7 * (smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, distance) + \n"
279//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.xy).a) +\n"
280//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.xy).a) +\n"
281//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.yx).a) +\n"
282//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.yx).a)),\n"
283            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000625, v_texCoords+0.000625);\n"
284            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
285            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
286            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
287            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
288            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
289            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
290            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
291            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
292            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
293            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y))),\n"
294//            + "                 char = step(distance, 0.35);\n"
295            + "                 fancy = step(0.55, distance);\n"
296//            + "                 outline = clamp((distance * 0.8 - 0.415) * 18.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n"
297            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * fancy, (asum + step(0.3, distance)) * v_color.a);\n"
298            + "  }\n"
299            + "}\n";
300    /**
301     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#msdfFragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around
302     * characters. This should be sharper than {@link #outlineFragmentShader},  but only works with MSDF (crisp) fonts.
303     * Unlike that shader, this doesn't have special behavior for negative
304     * {@link TextCellFactory#getSmoothingMultiplier()} values, though that may be added later.
305     * You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would look like
306     * {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.msdfOutlineFragmentShader)}, and
307     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
308     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
309     */
310    public static final String msdfOutlineFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
311            + " precision mediump float;\n"
312            + " precision mediump int;\n"
313            + "#endif\n"
314            + "\n"
315            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
316            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
317            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
318            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
319            + "\n"
320            + "void main() {\n"
321            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
322//            + "  float distance = (max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.425);\n"
323//            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(step(3.5 * u_smoothing, distance * 0.75) * v_color.rgb, clamp((distance / (3.4 * u_smoothing)) + 0.9125, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
324
325            //+ "  float cd = clamp(distance, 0.0, 1.0);"
326
327            + "  float d = ((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b))) - 0.4);\n"
328            + "  float block = step(-0.4999999, d);\n"
329            + "  float nice = step(0.24999999, d);\n"
330            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * nice, clamp(d * u_smoothing + (block + 1.0) * 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
331            + "}\n";
332
333    private SquidColorCenter scc;
334    private Texture tentacle;
335    private TextureRegion tentacleRegion;
336    private StatefulRNG guiRandom;
337
338    private static DefaultResources instance;
339
340    static BitmapFont copyFont(BitmapFont font)
341    {
342        if(font == null) return new BitmapFont();
343        return new BitmapFont(new BitmapFont.BitmapFontData(font.getData().getFontFile(), false),
344                font.getRegions(), font.usesIntegerPositions());
345    }
346    private DefaultResources()
347    {
348        if(Gdx.app == null)
349            throw new IllegalStateException("Gdx.app cannot be null; initialize GUI-using objects in create() or later.");
350        Gdx.app.addLifecycleListener(this);
351    }
352
353    private static void initialize()
354    {
355        if(instance == null)
356            instance = new DefaultResources();
357    }
358
359    /**
360     * Gets the one font guaranteed to be included in libGDX, which is Arial at size 15 px.
361     * @return the BitmapFont representing Arial.ttf at size 15 px
362     */
363    public static BitmapFont getIncludedFont()
364    {
365        initialize();
366        if(instance.arial15 == null)
367        {
368            try {
369                instance.arial15 = new BitmapFont();
370                //instance.narrow1.getData().padBottom = instance.narrow1.getDescent();
371            } catch (Exception ignored) {
372            }
373        }
374        return copyFont(instance.arial15);
375    }
376    /**
377     * Returns a 12x12px, stretched but curvaceous font as an embedded resource. Caches it for later calls.
378     * <br>
379     * Needs files:
380     * <ul>
381     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt</li>
382     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.png</li>
383     * </ul>
384     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Zodiac-Square.ttf at size 16 pt
385     */
386    public static BitmapFont getDefaultFont()
387    {
388        initialize();
389        if(instance.square1 == null)
390        {
391            try {
392                instance.square1 = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(squareName), Gdx.files.internal(squareTexture), false);
393                //instance.square1.getData().padBottom = instance.square1.getDescent();
394            } catch (Exception ignored) {
395            }
396        }
397        return copyFont(instance.square1);
398    }

493    /**
494     * Returns a 8x18px, very smooth and generally good-looking font (based on Inconsolata) as an embedded resource.
495     * This font fully supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and of particular interest to SquidLib, Box Drawing characters.
496     * Caches the font for later calls. You may prefer {@link #getCrispSmoothFont()}, which is the same font but should
497     * scale to more sizes and aspect ratios very smoothly.
498     * <br>
499     * Needs files:
500     * <ul>
501     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.fnt</li>
502     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-8x18.png</li>
503     * </ul>
504     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Inconsolata-LGC.ttf at size... pretty sure it's 8x18 pixels
505     */
506    public static BitmapFont getSmoothFont()
507    {
508        initialize();
509        if(instance.smooth1 == null)
510        {
511            try {
512                instance.smooth1 = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(smoothName), Gdx.files.internal(smoothTexture), false);
513                //instance.smooth1.getData().padBottom = instance.smooth1.getDescent();
514            } catch (Exception ignored) {
515            }
516        }
517        return copyFont(instance.smooth1);
518    }

592    /**
593     * Returns a 25x25px, very smooth and generally good-looking font (based on Inconsolata) as an embedded resource.
594     * This font fully supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and of particular interest to SquidLib, Box Drawing characters.
595     * This variant is (almost) perfectly square, and box drawing characters should line up at size 25x25 px, but other
596     * glyphs will have much more horizontal spacing than in other fonts. Caches the font for later calls. You may want
597     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} instead, which is the same font but can stretch smoothly to most sizes.
598     * <br>
599     * Needs files:
600     * <ul>
601     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.fnt</li>
602     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.png</li>
603     * </ul>
604     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Inconsolata-LGC-Square at size 25x25 pixels
605     */
606    public static BitmapFont getSquareSmoothFont()
607    {
608        initialize();
609        if(instance.smoothSquare == null)
610        {
611            try {
612                instance.smoothSquare = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(smoothSquareName), Gdx.files.internal(smoothSquareTexture), false);
613                //instance.smoothSquare.getData().padBottom = instance.smoothSquare.getDescent();
614            } catch (Exception ignored) {
615            }
616        }
617        return copyFont(instance.smoothSquare);
618    }
619    /**
620     * Returns a 4x10px, extremely thin font (that may be barely legible) as an embedded resource.
621     * The font builds on work by Christian Munk in his font called Monotwist, making some changes for legibility.
622     * This font has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with SquidLib. Caches the font for later calls.
623     * Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the
624     * license file linked below.
625     * <br>
626     * Needs files:
627     * <ul>
628     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-4x10.fnt</li>
629     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-4x10.png</li>
630     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-license.txt</li>
631     * </ul>
632     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Monty.ttf at size 8 pt
633     */
634    public static BitmapFont getTinyFont()
635    {
636        initialize();

638        {
639            try {
640                instance.tiny = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(tinyName), Gdx.files.internal(tinyTexture), false);
641                //instance.narrow1.getData().padBottom = instance.narrow1.getDescent();
642            } catch (Exception ignored) {
643            }
644        }
645        return copyFont(instance.tiny);
646    }
647    /**
648     * Returns a 8x20px, extremely thin font (that may be barely legible) as an embedded resource.
649     * The font builds on work by Christian Munk in his font called Monotwist, making some changes for legibility.
650     * A smaller version of this font, {@link #getTinyFont()}, has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with
651     * SquidLib; this doubles its resolution in case you like its appearance but don't want to go blind. Caches the font
652     * for later calls. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font;
653     * this is in the license file linked below.
654     * <br>
655     * Needs files:
656     * <ul>
657     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.fnt</li>
658     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.png</li>
659     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-license.txt</li>
660     * </ul>
661     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Monty.ttf at size 16 pt
662     */

667        {
668            try {

670            } catch (Exception ignored) {
671            }
672        }
673        return copyFont(instance.lessTiny);

675    /**
676     * Returns a 7x12px font with identical (excellent) Unicode coverage to Iosevka, as an embedded resource.
677     * The font is 7-12-serif by Christian Munk, but not all of the Unicode glyphs supported in his amazingly-huge font
678     * are present here; just the subset that's compatible with Iosevka (which is way more than is required for SquidLib
679     * to present most things). Caches the font for later calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of
680     * calling this method again, it won't stay monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk
681     * (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
682     * <br>
683     * Needs files:
684     * <ul>
685     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.fnt</li>
686     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.png</li>
687     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-license.txt</li>
688     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-readme.txt</li>
689     * </ul>
690     * @return the BitmapFont object representing 7-12-serif.ttf at a size that gives exactly 7 px wide by 12 px tall
691     */
692    public static BitmapFont getSevenTwelveFont()
693    {
694        initialize();
695        if(instance.sevenTwelve == null)
696        {
697            try {
698                instance.sevenTwelve = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveName), Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveTexture), false);
699            } catch (Exception ignored) {
700            }
701        }
702        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.sevenTwelve);
703        cpy.setFixedWidthGlyphs(" !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
704                "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\u00AD\n" +
705                "\n" +
706                "\n" +
707                "\n" +
708                "\n" +
709                "\n" +
710                "\n" +
711                "\n" +
712                "\n" +
713                "\n" +
714                "\n" +
715                "\n" +
716                "\n" +
717                "\n" +
718                "\n" +
719                "\n" +
720                "\n" +
721                "\n" +
722                "\n" +
723                "\n" +
724                "\n" +
725                "\n" +
726                "\n" +
727                "\n" +
728                "\n" +
729                "\n" +
730                "\n" +
731                "\n" +
732                "\u200B\u200C\u200D\u200E\u200F\u2028\u2029\u202A\u202B\u202C\u202D\u202E\n" +
733                "\u2060\u2061\u2062\u2063\u2064\u2066\u2067\u2068\u2069\u206A\u206B\u206C\u206D\u206E\u206F\n" +
734                "\n" +
735                "\n" +
736                "\n" +
737                "\n" +
738                "\n" +
739                "\n" +
740                "\n" +
741                "\n" +
742                "\n" +
743                "\n" +
744                "\n" +
745                "\n" +
746                "\n" +
747                "\n" +
748                "\n" +
749                "\n" +
750                "\n" +
751                "\n" +
752                "\n" +
753                "\n" +
754                "\n" +
755                "\n" +
756                "\n" +
757                "\n" +
758                "\n" +
759                "\n" +
760                "\n" +
761                "\n" +
762                "\n" +
763                "\n" +
764                "\n" +
765                "\n" +
766                "\n" +
767                "\n" +
768                "\n" +
769                "\n" +
770                "\n" +
771                "");
772        return cpy;
773    }
774    /**
775     * Returns a 14x27px font with fairly good Unicode coverage and an octagonal, angular look, as an embedded resource.
776     * The font is Computer Says No by Christian Munk, which has a nice clean appearance. Caches the font for later
777     * calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of calling this method again, it won't stay
778     * monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used,
779     * CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
780     * <br>
781     * Needs files:
782     * <ul>
783     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.fnt</li>
784     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.png</li>
785     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-license.txt</li>
786     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-readme.txt</li>
787     * </ul>
788     * @return the BitmapFont object representing ComputerSaysNo.ttf at a size that gives about 14 px wide by 27 px tall
789     */
790    public static BitmapFont getOctagonalMonoFont()
791    {
792        initialize();
793        if(instance.computerSaysNo == null)
794        {
795            try {
796                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoName), Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoTexture), false);
797            } catch (Exception e) {
798                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont();
799            }
800        }
801        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.computerSaysNo);
802        // ugh, this shouldn't be required...
803        cpy.setFixedWidthGlyphs("\u0000" +
804                " !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
805                "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\u00AD\n" +
806                "\n" +
807                "\n" +
808                "\n" +
809                "\n" +
810                "\n" +
811                "\n" +
812                "\n" +
813                "\n" +
814                "\n" +
815                "\n" +
816                "\n" +
817                "\n" +
818                "\n" +
819                "\n" +
820                "\n" +
821                "\n" +
822                "\n" +
823                "\n" +
824                "\n" +
825                "\n" +
826                "\n" +
827                "\n" +
828                "\n" +
829                "\n" +
830                "\n" +
831                "\n" +
832                "\n" +
833                "\n" +
834                "\n" +
835                "\n" +
836                "\n" +
837                "");
838        return cpy;
839    }

842     * Returns a 7x14px pixel font with broad coverage of Unicode, including Greek, Cyrillic, Braille, and tech-related
843     * icons. The font is <a href="https://github.com/slavfox/Cozette">Cozette by slavfox</a>. Caches the font for later
844     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
845     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
846     * <br>
847     * Needs files:
848     * <ul>
849     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Cozette.fnt</li>
850     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Cozette.png</li>
851     * </ul>
852     * @return the BitmapFont object representing CozetteVector.ttf at size 12 pt
853     */

858        {

860                instance.cozette = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(cozetteName), Gdx.files.internal(cozetteTexture), false);
861            } catch (Exception ignored) {
862            }
863        }
864        return copyFont(instance.cozette);
865    }

867    /**
868     * Returns a 7x14px pixel font with broad coverage of Unicode, including Greek, Cyrillic, Braille, and tech-related
869     * icons, with a black outline applied around the white inner strokes. The outline typically won't be colored when
870     * the rest of the font is, but the inner stroke changes color normally. The font is
871     * <a href="https://github.com/slavfox/Cozette">Cozette by slavfox</a>. Caches the font for later
872     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
873     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
874     * <br>
875     * Using this font in a TextCellFactory is experimental; it should be usable in scene2d.ui widgets, though.
876     * <br>
877     * Needs files:
878     * <ul>
879     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.fnt</li>
880     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.png</li>
881     * </ul>
882     * @return the BitmapFont object representing CozetteVector.ttf at size 12 pt with a square outline applied
883     */
884    public static BitmapFont getCozyOutlinedFont()
885    {
886        initialize();
887        if(instance.cozetteOutlined == null)
888        {
889            try {
890                instance.cozetteOutlined = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedName), Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedTexture), false);
891            } catch (Exception ignored) {
892            }
893        }
894        return copyFont(instance.cozetteOutlined);
895    }

897    /**
898     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes. This
899     * font is Inconsolata-LGC with the weight adjusted and some glyphs added from DejaVu Sans Mono. It supports a good
900     * range of Latin glyphs (not enough for Vietnamese, but enough for Western European languages), as well as the
901     * Greek and Cyrillic alphabets, box drawing characters, and some dingbats. Caches the result for later calls.
902     * <br>
903     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/DD1RkPa.png
904     * <br>
905     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
906     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
907     * <br>
908     * Needs files:
909     * <ul>
910     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.fnt</li>
911     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.png</li>
912     * </ul>
913     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font Inconsolata-LGC-Square.ttf
914     */
915    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSquareFont()
916    {
917        initialize();
918        if(instance.distanceSquare == null)
919        {
920            try {
921                instance.distanceSquare = new TextCellFactory().defaultDistanceFieldFont();
922            } catch (Exception ignored) {
923            }
924        }
925        if(instance.distanceSquare != null)
926            return instance.distanceSquare.copy();
927        return null;
928    }

930    /**
931     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an blocky, fairly-bold square font that should scale cleanly
932     * to many sizes. Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially,
933     * and is not a distorted/stretched version of an existing font. Caches the result for later calls.
934     * <br>
935     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
936     * <br>
937     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png">Preview at 6x6 size, https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png</a>
938     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png">Preview at much larger size, https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png</a>
939     * <br>
940     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
941     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
942     * <br>
943     * Needs files:
944     * <ul>
945     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.fnt</li>
946     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.png</li>
947     * </ul>
948     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font BoxedIn.ttf
949     */
950    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableHeavySquareFont()
951    {
952        initialize();
953        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare == null)
954        {
955            try {
956                instance.distanceHeavySquare = new TextCellFactory()
957                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldHeavySquare, distanceFieldHeavySquareTexture)
958                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(2.125f);
959            } catch (Exception ignored) {
960            }
961        }
962        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare != null)
963            return instance.distanceHeavySquare.copy();
964        return null;
965    }

967    /**
968     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an all-caps (with lighter-weight versions of upper-case
969     * letters for the lower-case glyphs) square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes.
970     * Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
971     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, and as said before, it doesn't
972     * have separate lower-case letters. Note: if you use this font as-is, most characters will overlap slightly with
973     * each other, which can be an aesthetic benefit in some styles but can also be hard to read, at least if the colors
974     * aren't different between overlapping characters. For that reason, you may want to tweak the width and height of
975     * this font after passing it to a SquidLayers or SparseLayers; often you would pass 0.875 times the original
976     * width and height to {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} and {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)}.
977     * Caches the result for later calls. The font is "square" by Wouter van Oortmerssen; it is available under a
978     * CC-BY-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Wouter van Oortmerssen if you use it.
979     * <br>
980     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 6f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
981     * <br>
982     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
983     * <br>
984     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
985     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
986     * <br>
987     * Needs files:
988     * <ul>
989     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.fnt</li>
990     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.png</li>
991     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-License.txt</li>
992     * </ul>
993     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font square.ttf
994     */
995    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCurvySquareFont()
996    {
997        initialize();
998        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare == null)
999        {
1000            try {
1001                instance.msdfCurvySquare = new TextCellFactory()
1002                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCurvySquare, crispCurvySquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(6f);
1003            } catch (Exception ignored) {
1004            }
1005        }
1006        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare != null)
1007            return instance.msdfCurvySquare.copy();
1008        return null;
1009    }

1011    /**
1012     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font with 45-degree angled sections, based on the
1013     * typeface used on the Atari ST console, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Unlike
1014     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
1015     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, but it supports all of it, unlike
1016     * {@link #getCrispCurvySquareFont()}. Caches the result for later calls. The font is "a-starry", based on "Atari ST
1017     * (low-res)" by Damien Guard; it is available under a CC-BY-SA-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Damien
1018     * Guard (and technically Tommy Ettinger, because he made changes in a-starry) if you use it.
1019     * <br>
1020     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 3f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1021     * <br>
1022     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
1023     * <br>
1024     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1025     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1026     * <br>
1027     * Needs files:
1028     * <ul>
1029     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.fnt</li>
1030     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.png</li>
1031     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-license.txt</li>
1032     * </ul>
1033     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font a-starry.ttf
1034     */
1035    public static TextCellFactory getCrispOctagonalSquareFont()
1036    {
1037        initialize();
1038        if(instance.msdfOctagonalSquare == null)
1039        {
1040            try {
1041                instance.msdfOctagonalSquare = new TextCellFactory()
1042                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispOctagonalSquare, crispOctagonalSquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3f);
1043            } catch (Exception ignored) {
1044            }
1045        }
1046        if(instance.msdfOctagonalSquare != null)
1047            return instance.msdfOctagonalSquare.copy();
1048        return null;
1049    }

1120    /**
1121     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with broad Unicode support
1122     * that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Source Code Pro, an
1123     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has good Unicode support among the fixed-width
1124     * fonts used by SquidLib. It may be a good choice for science-fiction games because of its modern feel, but the
1125     * legibility enhancements made so the font could be usable in text editors also are nice for all text-based games.
1126     * The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly
1127     * pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 15 and cell height of 27 is ideal;
1128     * this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.
1129     * <br>
1130     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/VC0xn2r.png
1131     * <br>
1132     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1133     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1134     * <br>
1135     * Needs files:
1136     * <ul>
1137     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.fnt</li>
1138     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.png</li>
1139     * </ul>
1140     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceCodePro-Medium.otf
1141     */
1142    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeFont()
1143    {
1144        initialize();
1145        if(instance.distanceCode == null)
1146        {
1147            try {
1148                instance.distanceCode = new TextCellFactory()
1149                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCode, distanceFieldCodeTexture);
1150            } catch (Exception e) {
1151                e.printStackTrace();
1152            }
1153        }
1154        if(instance.distanceCode != null)
1155            return instance.distanceCode.copy();
1156        return null;
1157    }
1158    /**
1159     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with strong CJK support (in
1160     * particular, very good coverage for Japanese) that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1161     * calls. The font used is Source Han Code JP, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has
1162     * the best CJK char support among the fonts used by SquidLib. It is extremely wide if used only for English text,
1163     * which may be desirable to make square cells. The very high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1164     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1165     * width of 19 and cell height of 20 is ideal; this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes.
1166     * <br>
1167     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1168     * <br>
1169     * Preview: https://i.imgur.com/g65jXxB.png
1170     * <br>
1171     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1172     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1173     * <br>
1174     * Needs files:
1175     * <ul>
1176     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.fnt</li>
1177     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.png</li>
1178     * </ul>
1179     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceHanCodeJP-Regular.otf
1180     */
1181    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeJPFont()
1182    {
1183        initialize();
1184        if(instance.distanceCodeJP == null)
1185        {
1186            try {
1187                instance.distanceCodeJP = new TextCellFactory()
1188                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCodeJP, distanceFieldCodeJPTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.125f);
1189            } catch (Exception e) {
1190                e.printStackTrace();
1191            }
1192        }
1193        if(instance.distanceCodeJP != null)
1194            return instance.distanceCodeJP.copy();
1195        return null;
1196    }
1197    /**
1198     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1199     * and a thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font
1200     * used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1201     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1202     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1203     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1204     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1205     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1206     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1207     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1208     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1209     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1210     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and
1211     * {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}.
1212     * <br>
1213     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/sm0ULbU.png
1214     * <br>
1215     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1216     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1217     * <br>
1218     * Needs files:
1219     * <ul>
1220     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.fnt</li>
1221     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.png</li>
1222     * </ul>
1223     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf
1224     */
1225    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableLeanFont()
1226    {
1227        initialize();
1228        if(instance.distanceLean == null)
1229        {
1230            try {
1231                instance.distanceLean = new TextCellFactory()
1232                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldLean, distanceFieldLeanTexture);
1233            } catch (Exception e) {
1234                e.printStackTrace();
1235            }
1236        }
1237        if(instance.distanceLean != null)
1238            return instance.distanceLean.copy();
1239        return null;
1240    }

1242    /**

1244     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1245     * font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1246     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1247     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1248     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1249     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1250     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1251     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1252     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1253     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1254     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1255     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and
1256     * {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}.

1261     * distance field font technique this uses can work.

1264     * <ul>
1265     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-distance.fnt</li>
1266     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-distance.png</li>
1267     * </ul>
1268     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf
1269     */

1274        {
1275            try {
1276                instance.distanceSlab = new TextCellFactory()
1277                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldSlab, distanceFieldSlabTexture);
1278            } catch (Exception e) {
1279                e.printStackTrace();
1280            }
1281        }
1282        if(instance.distanceSlab != null)
1283            return instance.distanceSlab.copy();
1284        return null;

1286    /**

1288     * and a very thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1289     * font used is Iosevka (at Light weight), an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1290     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1291     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1292     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1293     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1294     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1295     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1296     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1297     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1298     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1299     * also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and
1300     * {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.

1331    /**
1332     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1333     * and a very thin, slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1334     * calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style at Light weight, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface
1335     * by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to
1336     * Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1337     * Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count
1338     * means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts
1339     * small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate
1340     * multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an
1341     * aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A
1342     * tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab
1343     * serifs and the other version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()}, though they have subtly
1344     * different sizes. There are also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by
1345     * {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.
1346     * <br>
1347     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/B5eSGfj.png
1348     * <br>
1349     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1350     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1351     * <br>
1352     * Needs files:
1353     * <ul>
1354     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.fnt</li>
1355     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.png</li>
1356     * </ul>
1357     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab-Light.ttf
1358     */
1359    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSlabLightFont()
1360    {
1361        initialize();
1362        if(instance.distanceSlabLight == null)
1363        {
1364            try {
1365                instance.distanceSlabLight = new TextCellFactory()
1366                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldSlabLight, distanceFieldSlabLightTexture);
1367            } catch (Exception e) {
1368                e.printStackTrace();
1369            }
1370        }
1371        if(instance.distanceSlabLight != null)
1372            return instance.distanceSlabLight.copy();
1373        return null;
1374    }
1375    
1376    /**
1377     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a font with extremely wide Unicode support that should scale
1378     * cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font is DejaVu Sans Mono, a common font on Linux
1379     * operating systems and a clean-looking, legible font, though it has some visual quirks like a "tail" on lower-case
1380     * 'l', that take some getting used to. A possible requirement for this font is that the size of the text in a
1381     * SquidPanel or SquidLayers may need to be increased 1-5 pixels past what the cell width and height are; this can
1382     * be done with {@link SquidPanel#setTextSize(float, float)} or {@link SquidLayers#setTextSize(float, float)},
1383     * giving 1-2 more than the cell width for x and 3-5 more than the cell height for y.
1384     * <br>
1385     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/1haETOe.png
1386     * <br>
1387     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1388     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1389     * <br>
1390     * Needs files:
1391     * <ul>
1392     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.fnt</li>
1393     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.png</li>
1394     * </ul>
1395     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf
1396     */
1397    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableDejaVuFont()
1398    {
1399        initialize();
1400        if(instance.distanceDejaVu == null)
1401        {
1402            try {
1403                instance.distanceDejaVu = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldDejaVu, distanceFieldDejaVuTexture);
1404            } catch (Exception e) {
1405                e.printStackTrace();
1406            }
1407        }
1408        if(instance.distanceDejaVu != null)
1409            return instance.distanceDejaVu.copy();
1410        return null;
1411
1412    }
1413    /**
1414     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1415     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Meant to be used in variable-
1416     * width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1417     * <br>
1418     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/eIYYt8C.png
1419     * <br>
1420     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1421     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1422     * <br>
1423     * Needs files:
1424     * <ul>
1425     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.fnt</li>
1426     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.png</li>
1427     * </ul>
1428     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Gentium, by SIL
1429     */
1430    public static TextCellFactory getStretchablePrintFont() {
1431        initialize();
1432        if (instance.distancePrint == null) {
1433            try {
1434                instance.distancePrint = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldPrint, distanceFieldPrintTexture)
1435                        .height(30).width(7);
1436                instance.distancePrint.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1437                
1438            } catch (Exception e) {
1439                e.printStackTrace();
1440            }
1441        }
1442        if(instance.distancePrint != null)
1443            return instance.distancePrint.copy();
1444        return null;
1445    }

1448     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font that should have a blocky,
1449     * futuristic look (based on the font Orbitron), and that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Meant to be used in
1450     * variable-width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1451     * <br>

1453     * <br>

1455     * <br>

1457     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1458     * <br>

1460     * <ul>
1461     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Orbitron-distance.fnt</li>

1463     * </ul>
1464     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Orbitron, by The League of Movable Type
1465     */
1466    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableOrbitFont() {
1467        initialize();
1468        if (instance.distanceOrbit == null) {
1469            try {
1470                instance.distanceOrbit = new TextCellFactory().setDirectionGlyph('')
1471                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldOrbit, distanceFieldOrbitTexture)
1472                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.3f).height(30).width(11);
1473            } catch (Exception e) {
1474                e.printStackTrace();
1475            }
1476        }
1477        if(instance.distanceOrbit != null)
1478            return instance.distanceOrbit.copy();
1479        return null;

1482    /**
1483     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font that currently looks
1484     * slightly jumbled without certain layout features. Meant to be used in variable-width displays like TextPanel, but
1485     * currently you should prefer getStretchablePrintFont() for legibility. Caches the result for later calls.
1486     * <br>
1487     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 0.8, instead of the default 1.2f. If you set the smoothing multiplier
1488     * yourself, it should be similarly smaller than what other fonts use (most fonts are 1.2, so multiplying whatever
1489     * you would normally set the smoothing multiplier to by 0.66f should work).
1490     * <br>
1491     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/GF5qQxn.png
1492     * <br>
1493     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1494     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1495     * <br>
1496     * Needs files:
1497     * <ul>
1498     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.fnt</li>
1499     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.png</li>
1500     * </ul>
1501     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Sans, by Google
1502     */
1503    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCleanFont() {
1504        initialize();
1505        if (instance.distanceClean == null) {
1506            try {
1507                instance.distanceClean = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldClean, distanceFieldCleanTexture)
1508                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(0.8f).height(30).width(5);
1509                instance.distanceClean.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1510            } catch (Exception e) {
1511                e.printStackTrace();
1512            }
1513        }
1514        if(instance.distanceClean != null)
1515            return instance.distanceClean.copy();
1516        return null;
1517    }
1518
1519    /**
1520     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1521     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1522     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1523     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1524     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin,
1525     * Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1526     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1527     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography
1528     * expert) called Iosevka
1529     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1530     * <br>
1531     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/YlzFEVX.png">Image link</a>
1532     * <br>
1533     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1534     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1535     * <br>
1536     * Needs files:
1537     * <ul>
1538     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.fnt</li>
1539     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.png</li>
1540     * </ul>
1541     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf using MSDF
1542     */
1543    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabFont()
1544    {
1545        initialize();
1546        if(instance.msdfSlab == null)
1547        {
1548            try {
1549                instance.msdfSlab = new TextCellFactory()
1550                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispSlab, crispSlabTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.5f);
1551            } catch (Exception e) {
1552                e.printStackTrace();
1553            }
1554        }
1555        if(instance.msdfSlab != null)
1556            return instance.msdfSlab.copy();
1557        return null;
1558    }
1559    /**
1560     * Not supported; use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead, using {@link GDXMarkup} to add italics with its
1561     * {@code [/]} tag.
1562     * @return always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1563     * @deprecated use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead
1564     */
1565    @Deprecated
1566    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabItalicFont()
1567    {
1568        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Use getCrispSlabFamily() instead, with GDXMarkup to add italics.");
1569    }

1579     * expert) called Iosevka
1580     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>

1622    /**
1623     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width font with excellent Unicode support

1627     * including most extended Latin (though it doesn't support a handful of chars used by  FakeLanguageGen), Greek,
1628     * Braille, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1629     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1630     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1631     * <br>
1632     *
1633     * <br>

1635     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.

1639     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CascadiaMono-msdf.fnt</li>

1641     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Cascadia-license.txt</li>
1642     * </ul>

1644     */

1647        initialize();
1648        if(instance.msdfCascadia == null)
1649        {
1650            try {
1651                instance.msdfCascadia = new TextCellFactory()
1652                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCascadia, crispCascadiaTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
1653            } catch (Exception e) {
1654                e.printStackTrace();
1655            }
1656        }
1657        if(instance.msdfCascadia != null)
1658            return instance.msdfCascadia.copy();
1659        return null;

1661    /**
1662     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width sans-serif font with excellent Unicode support,
1663     * that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is DejaVu
1664     * Sans Mono, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface that is widely used by Linux distros and other groups.
1665     * It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the
1666     * necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the
1667     * normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow sharper edges. It has been updated so it is laid out
1668     * mostly-correctly now; some glyphs may be a little wide, such as {@code @}, but the line height, baseline, and the
1669     * width for most glyphs seem correct. If you find the box drawing characters don't line up, try 
1670     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} with values like 1.125f; the exact value may depend on size.
1671     * <br>
1672     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1673     * <br>
1674     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/SCwhduv.png">Image link</a>
1675     * <br>
1676     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1677     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1678     * <br>
1679     * Needs files:
1680     * <ul>
1681     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.fnt</li>
1682     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.png</li>
1683     * </ul>
1684     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf with an MSDF effect
1685     */
1686    public static TextCellFactory getCrispDejaVuFont()
1687    {
1688        initialize();
1689        if(instance.msdfDejaVu == null)
1690        {
1691            try {
1692                instance.msdfDejaVu = new TextCellFactory()
1693                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispDejaVu, crispDejaVuTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2.5f);
1694            } catch (Exception e) {
1695                e.printStackTrace();
1696            }
1697        }
1698        if(instance.msdfDejaVu != null)
1699            return instance.msdfDejaVu.copy();
1700        return null;
1701    }
1702    /**

1704     * cleanly to many sizes. This font is Inconsolata-LGC with the weight adjusted and some glyphs added from DejaVu
1705     * Sans Mono. It supports a good range of Latin glyphs (not enough for Vietnamese, but enough for Western European
1706     * languages), as well as the Greek and Cyrillic alphabets, box drawing characters, and some dingbats. This uses the
1707     * Multi-channel Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which
1708     * should allow sharper edges. Caches the result for later calls.
1709     * <br>

1714     * <ul>
1715     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Custom-msdf.fnt</li>

1718     * </ul>

1720     */
