1738    /**
1739     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1740     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1741     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source
1742     * (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several
1743     * customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs,
1744     * including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the
1745     * necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the
1746     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1747     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1748     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1749     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1750     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1751     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getLeanFamily()}.
1752     * <br>
1753     * <br>
1754     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1755     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1756     * <br>
1757     * Needs files:
1758     * <ul>
1759     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1760     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.png</li>
1761     * </ul>
1762     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles
1763     */
1764    public static TextFamily getSlabFamily()
1765    {
1766        initialize();
1767        if(instance.familySlab == null)
1768        {
1769            try {
1770                instance.familySlab = new TextFamily().defaultFamilySlabDistance();
1771            } catch (Exception e) {
1772                e.printStackTrace();
1773            }
1774        }
1775        if(instance.familySlab != null)
1776            return instance.familySlab.copy();
1777        return null;
1778    }
1779    /**
1780     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1781     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1782     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1783     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1784     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite
1785     * a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing
1786     * characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1787     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1788     * width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the
1789     * font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert)
1790     * called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1791     * You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has,
1792     * {@link #getSlabFamily()}.
1793     * <br>
1794     * <br>
1795     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1796     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1797     * <br>
1798     * Needs files:
1799     * <ul>
1800     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1801     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.png</li>
1802     * </ul>
1803     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles
1804     */
1805    public static TextFamily getLeanFamily()
1806    {
1807        initialize();
1808        if(instance.familyLean == null)
1809        {
1810            try {
1811                instance.familyLean = new TextFamily().defaultFamilyLeanDistance();
1812            } catch (Exception e) {
1813                e.printStackTrace();
1814            }
1815        }
1816        if(instance.familyLean != null)
1817            return instance.familyLean.copy();
1818        return null;
1819    }
1820    /**
1821     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a traditional
1822     * serif style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1823     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Go Mono, a typeface released by the team
1824     * behind the Go programming language as open-source (3-clause BSD, the same license as the Go language; the license
1825     * is included with the assets). It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1826     * Cyrillic, bu also the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). There's more
1827     * information about this font available where it was introduced,
1828     * <a href="https://blog.golang.org/go-fonts">on the Go blog</a>.
1829     * You may want to try using this Go font family and contrasting it with Iosevka with and without slab serifs, which
1830     * are {@link #getSlabFamily()} and {@link #getLeanFamily()} respectively.
1831     * <br>
1832     * <br>
1833     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1834     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1835     * <br>
1836     * Needs files:
1837     * <ul>
1838     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1839     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.png</li>
1840     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-License.txt</li>
1841     * </ul>
1842     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font GoMono.ttf with 4 styles
1843     */
1844    public static TextFamily getGoFamily()
1845    {
1846        initialize();
1847        if(instance.familyGo == null)
1848        {
1849            try {
1850                instance.familyGo = new TextFamily();
1851                instance.familyGo.fontDistanceField("GoMono-Family-distance.fnt", "GoMono-Family-distance.png");
1852            } catch (Exception e) {
1853                e.printStackTrace();
1854            }
1855        }
1856        if(instance.familyGo != null)
1857            return instance.familyGo.copy();
1858        return null;
1859    }
1860    /**
1861     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1862     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1863     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an
1864     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it 
1865     * uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot
1866     * of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and
1867     * the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture
1868     * that holds all four faces of the font is larger than normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices
1869     * to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets). A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some
1870     * approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using
1871     * Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed
1872     * Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips
1873     * on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka
1874     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to
1875     * try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, 
1876     * {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}.
1877     * <br>
1878     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/dMVzpEi.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1879     * <br>
1880     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1881     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1882     * <br>
1883     * Needs files:
1884     * <ul>
1885     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1886     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.png</li>
1887     * </ul>
1888     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1889     */
1890    public static TextFamily getCrispLeanFamily()
1891    {
1892        initialize();
1893        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF == null)
1894        {
1895            try {
1896                instance.familyLeanMSDF = new TextFamily();
1897                instance.familyLeanMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Family-msdf.png");
1898            } catch (Exception e) {
1899                e.printStackTrace();
1900            }
1901        }
1902        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF != null)
1903            return instance.familyLeanMSDF.copy();
1904        return null;
1905
1906    }
1907
1908    /**
1909     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1910     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1911     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with
1912     * slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1913     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1914     * process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek,
1915     * and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even 
1916     * for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture that holds all four faces of the font is larger than
1917     * normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets).
1918     * A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this
1919     * allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed
1920     * Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed  Distance Field technique, which gives the
1921     * rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1922     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1923     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1924     * version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}.
1925     * <br>
1926     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.55f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1927     * <br>
1928     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wRNlpL5.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1929     * <br>
1930     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1931     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1932     * <br>
1933     * Needs files:
1934     * <ul>
1935     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1936     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png</li>
1937     * </ul>
1938     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1939     */
1940    public static TextFamily getCrispSlabFamily()
1941    {
1942        initialize();
1943        if(instance.familySlabMSDF == null)
1944        {
1945            try {
1946                instance.familySlabMSDF = new TextFamily();
1947                instance.familySlabMSDF
1948                        .fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png")
1949                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.55f);
1950            } catch (Exception e) {
1951                e.printStackTrace();
1952            }
1953        }
1954        if(instance.familySlabMSDF != null)
1955            return instance.familySlabMSDF.copy();
1956        return null;
1957
1958    }
1959    /**
1960     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1961     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes using an MSDF technique, and
1962     * supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is 
1963     * Noto Serif, which is OFL-licensed by Google, and looks very legible in normal use. Meant to be used in
1964     * variable-width displays like TextPanel.
1965     * <br>
1966     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.5f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1967     * <br>
1968     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WsDqSfJ.png">In the foreground message box in ZoneDemo</a>
1969     * <br>
1970     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1971     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1972     * <br>
1973     * Needs files:
1974     * <ul>
1975     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1976     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.png</li>
1977     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-license.txt</li>
1978     * </ul>
1979     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Serif, made available by Google
1980     */
1981    public static TextFamily getCrispPrintFamily() {
1982        initialize();
1983        if (instance.familyPrintMSDF == null) {
1984            try {
1985                instance.familyPrintMSDF = new TextFamily();
1986                instance.familyPrintMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField(crispNotoSerif, crispNotoSerifTexture)
1987                        .width(7).height(30).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.5f);
1988                instance.familyPrintMSDF.font().setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1989            } catch (Exception e) {
1990                e.printStackTrace();
1991            }
1992        }
1993        if(instance.familyPrintMSDF != null)
1994            return instance.familyPrintMSDF.copy();
1995        return null;
1996    }
1997    /**
1998     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a partially-angular variable-width font with good Unicode
1999     * support and an appearance as if it were carved into solid rock, that should scale cleanly to even very large
2000     * sizes (using an MSDF technique). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is
2001     * <a href="https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/507930/bloccus">Bloccus by Christian Munk</a>. It supports a
2002     * lot of glyphs, including most of extended Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA),
2003     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
2004     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
2005     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
2006     * <br>
2007     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
2008     * <br>
2009     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zaqgHTW.png">Image link</a>
2010     * <br>
2011     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2012     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2013     * <br>
2014     * Needs files:
2015     * <ul>
2016     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.fnt</li>
2017     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.png</li>
2018     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-license.txt</li>
2019     * </ul>
2020     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font bloccus.ttf
2021     */
2022    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCarvedFont()
2023    {
2024        initialize();
2025        if(instance.msdfCarved == null)
2026        {
2027            try {
2028                instance.msdfCarved = new TextCellFactory()
2029                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCarved, crispCarvedTexture)
2030                        .width(7f).height(24f).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.0f);
2031            } catch (Exception e) {
2032                e.printStackTrace();
2033            }
2034        }
2035        if(instance.msdfCarved != null)
2036            return instance.msdfCarved.copy();
2037        return null;
2038    }
2039    /**
2040     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font with good Unicode support
2041     * and a no-nonsense look, that should scale cleanly to even very large or small sizes (using an MSDF technique).
2042     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Roboto">Roboto
2043     * Regular by Christian Robertson</a>. It supports a lot of glyphs, including most Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic,
2044     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
2045     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
2046     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
2047     * <br>
2048     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
2049     * <br>
2050     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ASjdjc6.png">Image link when scaled to a small size</a>
2051     * <br>
2052     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2053     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2054     * <br>
2055     * Needs files:
2056     * <ul>
2057     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.fnt</li>
2058     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.png</li>
2059     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-License.txt</li>
2060     * </ul>
2061     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Roboto-Regular.ttf
2062     */
2063    public static TextCellFactory getCrispRobotoSansFont()
2064    {
2065        initialize();
2066        if(instance.msdfRoboto == null)
2067        {
2068            try {
2069                instance.msdfRoboto = new TextCellFactory()
2070                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispRobotoSans, crispRobotoSansTexture)
2071                        .width(3f).height(14f).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
2072            } catch (Exception e) {
2073                e.printStackTrace();
2074            }
2075        }
2076        if(instance.msdfRoboto != null)
2077            return instance.msdfRoboto.copy();
2078        return null;
2079    }

2081    /**
2082     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width icon font (no letters are supported) using the
2083     * Font-Awesome icon set, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls.
2084     * The icon font used is the popular Font-Awesome free set (solid style), an open-source (SIL Open Font License)
2085     * typeface that is often used online. You will probably want to consult the cheatsheet for what chars are actually
2086     * supported; <a href="https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet">the cheatsheet is here</a>. This uses the Multi-channel
2087     * Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow
2088     * sharper edges. You may also want the list of all chars in this icon font; {@link #iconFontAll} has that.
2089     * <br>
2090     * Preview: <a href="">Image link</a>
2091     * <br>
2092     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2093     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2094     * <br>
2095     * Needs files:
2096     * <ul>
2097     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.fnt</li>
2098     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.png</li>
2099     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Font-Awesome-license.txt</li>
2100     * </ul>
2101     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of Font Awesome Free (solid) with an MSDF effect
2102     */
2103    public static TextCellFactory getCrispIconFont()
2104    {
2105        initialize();
2106        if(instance.msdfIcons == null)
2107        {
2108            try {
2109                instance.msdfIcons = new TextCellFactory()
2110                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispIcons, crispIconsTexture);
2111            } catch (Exception e) {
2112                e.printStackTrace();
2113            }
2114        }
2115        if(instance.msdfIcons != null)
2116            return instance.msdfIcons.copy();
2117        return null;
2118
2119    }

2123    /**
2124     * Gets an image of a (squid-like, for SquidLib) tentacle, 32x32px.
2125     * Source is public domain: http://opengameart.org/content/496-pixel-art-icons-for-medievalfantasy-rpg
2126     * Created by Henrique Lazarini (7Soul1, http://7soul1.deviantart.com/ )
2127     * <br>
2128     * Needs file:
2129     * <ul>
2130     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Tentacle.png</li>
2131     * </ul>
2132     * @return a TextureRegion containing an image of a tentacle.
2133     */
2134    public static TextureRegion getTentacle()
2135    {
2136        initialize();
2137        if(instance.tentacle == null || instance.tentacleRegion == null)
2138        {
2139            try {
2140                instance.tentacle = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal("Tentacle.png"));
2141                instance.tentacleRegion = new TextureRegion(instance.tentacle);
2142            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2143            }
2144        }
2145        return instance.tentacleRegion;
2146    }

2149    /**
2150     * Gets a TextureAtlas containing many icons with a distance field effect applied, allowing them to be used with
2151     * "stretchable" fonts and be resized in the same way. These will not look as-expected if stretchable fonts are not
2152     * in use, and will seem hazy and indistinct if the shader hasn't been set up for a distance field effect by
2153     * TextCellFactory (which stretchable fonts will do automatically). The one page of the TextureAtlas is 2048x2048,
2154     * which may be too large for some old, low-end Android phones, and possibly integrated graphics with fairly old
2155     * processors on desktop. It has over 2000 icons.
2156     * <br>
2157     * The icons are CC-BY and the license is distributed with them, though the icons are not necessarily included with
2158     * SquidLib. If you use the icon atlas, be sure to include icons-license.txt with it and reference it with your
2159     * game's license and/or credits information.
2160     * <br>
2161     * Needs files:
2162     * <ul>
2163     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.atlas</li>
2164     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.png</li>
2165     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons-license.txt Needed to credit artists</li>
2166     * </ul>
2167     * @return a TextureAtlas containing over 2000 icons with a distance field effect
2168     */
2169    public static TextureAtlas getIconAtlas()
2170    {
2171        initialize();
2172        if(instance.iconAtlas == null)
2173        {
2174            try {
2175                instance.iconAtlas = new TextureAtlas(Gdx.files.internal("icons.atlas"));
2176            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2177            }
2178        }
2179        return instance.iconAtlas;
2180    }

2182    /**
2183     * This is a static global StatefulRNG that's meant for usage in cases where the seed does not matter and any
2184     * changes to this RNG's state will not change behavior elsewhere in the program; this means the GUI mainly.
2185     */
2186    public static StatefulRNG getGuiRandom()
2187    {
2188        initialize();
2189        if(instance.guiRandom == null)
2190        {
2191            instance.guiRandom =  new StatefulRNG();
2192        }
2193        return instance.guiRandom;
2194    }
2195    /**
2196     * This is a static global SquidColorCenter that can be used in places that just need an existing object that can do
2197     * things like analyze hue or saturation of a color.
2198     */
2199    public static SquidColorCenter getSCC()
2200    {
2201        initialize();
2202        if(instance.scc == null)
2203        {
2204            instance.scc =  new SquidColorCenter();
2205        }
2206        return instance.scc;
2207    }

2211     */
2212    public static final String narrowFontSymbols = "";
2213    public static final String narrowFontAll = " !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123\n" +
2214                                          "456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFG\n" +
2215                                          "HIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\n" +
2216                                          "\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
2217                                          "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\n" +
2218                                          "\u00AD\n" +
2219                                          "\n" +
2220                                          "\n" +
2221                                          "\n" +
2222                                          ""+
2223                                          ""+ // left, up, right, down, "tap", "counterclockwise", "clockwise"
2224                                          "\n" +
2225                                          "\n" +
2226                                          "\n" +
2227                                          "\n" +
2228                                          "\n" +
2229                                          "\n" +

2235                                          "";
2236    /**
2237     * All of the Font-Awesome Free (solid style) characters in {@link #getCrispIconFont()}, as a String.
